publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4618 George Foulkes: Barred Campaign Goes Nationwide—That the Parliament congratulates the Barred campaign, led by Mark Cooper, which seeks to improve the accessibility for disabled people of licensed premises across Edinburgh and now Scotland; recognises that the campaign has been adopted by Capability Scotland; looks forward to the campaign’s development and future successes, and believes that no one should be barred from accessing a pub or club or receive a poorer standard of service because of a perceived disability.

S3M-4618 Barred Campaign Goes Nationwide (lodged on 22 July 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Jackie Baillie*, Michael McMahon*, Patricia Ferguson*, Bill Kidd*, Mary Mulligan*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Marlyn Glen*, John Park*, Ken Macintosh*, Helen Eadie*, Mr Frank McAveety*

S3M-4618 Barred Campaign Goes Nationwide (lodged on 22 July 2009) Trish Godman*, Cathy Jamieson*, James Kelly*, Robin Harper*, David Whitton*, Jack McConnell*, Mike Pringle*, Sarah Boyack*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S3M-4618 Barred Campaign Goes Nationwide (lodged on 22 July 2009) Cathy Peattie*

S3M-4618 *#* George Foulkes: Barred Campaign Goes Nationwide—That the Parliament congratulates the Barred campaign, led by Mark Cooper, which seeks to improve the accessibility of licensed premises for disabled people across Edinburgh and now Scotland; recognises that the campaign has been adopted by Capability Scotland; looks forward to the campaign’s development and future successes, and believes that no one should be barred from accessing a pub or club or receive a poorer standard of service because of a perceived disability. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S3M-4618# George Foulkes: Barred Campaign Goes Nationwide—That the Parliament congratulates the Barred campaign, led by Mark Cooper, which seeks to improve the accessibility of licensed premises for disabled people across Edinburgh and now Scotland; recognises that the campaign has been adopted by Capability Scotland; looks forward to the campaign’s development and future successes, and believes that no one should be barred from accessing a pub or club or receive a poorer standard of service because of a perceived disability. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Jackie Baillie, Michael McMahon, Patricia Ferguson, Bill Kidd, Mary Mulligan, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Marlyn Glen, John Park, Ken Macintosh, Helen Eadie, Mr Frank McAveety, Trish Godman, Cathy Jamieson, James Kelly, Robin Harper, David Whitton, Jack McConnell, Mike Pringle, Sarah Boyack, Marilyn Livingstone, Cathy Peattie
S3M-4618# Barred Campaign Goes Nationwide (lodged on 23 September 2009) Stuart McMillan*
S3M-4618# Barred Campaign Goes Nationwide (lodged on 23 September 2009) Robert Brown* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J

S3M-4618# George Foulkes: Barred Campaign Goes Nationwide—That the Parliament congratulates the Barred campaign, led by Mark Cooper, which seeks to improve the accessibility of licensed premises for disabled people across Edinburgh and now Scotland; recognises that the campaign has been adopted by Capability Scotland; looks forward to the campaign’s development and future successes, and believes that no one should be barred from accessing a pub or club or receive a poorer standard of service because of a perceived disability. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Jackie Baillie, Michael McMahon, Patricia Ferguson, Bill Kidd, Mary Mulligan, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Marlyn Glen, John Park, Ken Macintosh, Helen Eadie, Mr Frank McAveety, Trish Godman, Cathy Jamieson, James Kelly, Robin Harper, David Whitton, Jack McConnell, Mike Pringle, Sarah Boyack, Marilyn Livingstone, Cathy Peattie, Stuart McMillan, Robert Brown, Rhona Brankin*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Richard Baker*, Karen Gillon*, Margaret Curran*, Alison McInnes*, Claire Baker* Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S3M-4618# Barred Campaign Goes Nationwide (lodged on 23 September 2009) Angela Constance*, Bob Doris*, Margo MacDonald* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
